title: Introduction to Module: Overview of ML and AI
summary: Kick-off lecture giving a broad overview of AI, ML, DL, and Data Science through real-world use cases and history.
objectives: Understand the scope of the module
See how AI connects across everyday life, core terms, history, and GenAI
Get motivated for upcoming hands-on learning

title: What all is AI? â€“ Foundation
summary: Spot AI in daily apps; hands-on phone demo to see CV/ML/NLP in action.
objectives: Open minds to how pervasive AI already is
Recognize CV, NLP, and personalization examples
Connect real apps (Photos, Maps, Spotify, ChatGPT) to AI concepts

title: AI vs ML vs DL vs DS
summary: Untangle terms and overlaps with crisp examples and a simple venn mental model.
objectives: Define AI, ML, DL, DS clearly
Map tasks to the right bucket with examples

title: History of AI & Major Milestones
summary: From Dartmouth and backprop to AlphaGo and Transformers; why each mattered.
objectives: Grasp key milestones and their impact
Internalize backprop as the learning feedback loop
Understand attention/transformers at a high level

title: GenAI, Use-cases, and Future Landscape
summary: Modern LLM stack (tokens, embeddings, transformers) and where jobs emerge.
objectives: Link GenAI capabilities to real use-cases/tools
Identify roles: research, applied AI, GenAI builders
